Actually yes. In the documentation they all use standard REST api, with url, payload ecc. But at the begin the suggest you to use client (I use python). I'm choose to go with the python client and I do not find the corrispondent method
Here's the code using the python client:

```import HubSpot
from pprint import pprint
from HubSpot.crm.contacts import ApiException

client = HubSpot.Client.create(access_token="YOUR_ACCESS_TOKEN")

try:
    api_response = client.crm.contacts.basic_api.get_by_id(contact_id="contactId", properties=["jobtitle"], archived=False)
    pprint(api_response)
except ApiException as e:
    print("Exception when calling basic_api->get_by_id: %s\n" % e)```
You can find the documentation here: <https://developers.HubSpot.com/docs/api/crm/contacts>
